title: How to photoshop images
description: Below is a tutorial for image editing. Feel free to ask any questions with the photoshopping tag. 1. Take an image you like: [![weeklyd3-1652142164-0-image.png](files/download.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142164-0-image.png)](viewfile.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142164-0-image.png) 2. Next, open it in your favorite image editor: [![weeklyd3-1652142203-0-image.png](files/download.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142203-0-image.png)](viewfile.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142203-0-image.png) 3. Make the edits you want: 1. Here, I copy-pasted a traffic light: [![weeklyd3-1652142245-0-image.png](files/download.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142245-0-image.png)](viewfile.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142245-0-image.png) 1. Use the rectangle select tool to select the traffic light. 2. Press Ctrl-C and Ctrl-V to paste it. 3. Use the move tool to move it. 4. Press Ctrl-H to remove the floating layer. 2. Repeat however much you like: [![weeklyd3-1652142355-0-image.png](files/download.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142355-0-image.png)](viewfile.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142355-0-image.png) 3. To save it, go to File > Export. Then, save it with an appropriate filename. 4. The finished image: [![weeklyd3-1652142450-0-image.png](files/download.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142450-0-image.png)](viewfile.php?filename=weeklyd3-1652142450-0-image.png)
description_html:
Below is a tutorial for image editing. Feel free to ask any questions with the photoshopping tag.

  1. Take an image you like:

  2. Next, open it in your favorite image editor:

  3. Make the edits you want:

    1. Here, I copy-pasted a traffic light:
      1. Use the rectangle select tool to select the traffic light.
      2. Press Ctrl-C and Ctrl-V to paste it.
      3. Use the move tool to move it.
      4. Press Ctrl-H to remove the floating layer.
    2. Repeat however much you like:

  4. To save it, go to File > Export. Then, save it with an appropriate filename.

  5. The finished image:
author: weeklyd3
